content: push_cast with ((2 : nat) : int) then I get 1 + 1. Getting rid of the norm_cast attribute on int.coe_nat_succ fixes this problem, and push_cast gives me (2 : int). I can see there's been some attempt to fix it by setting a lower priority to the norm_cast attribute on int.coe_nat_succ, but this fix is obviously not working any more. One fix I found, was to get rid of the norm_cast attribute on int.coe_nat_succ and put the attribute on nat.succ_eq_add_one, but this seems like it might be evil.
